scenario_name: Model Inversion Attack on Customer Churn Prediction
description: A malicious actor attempts to reconstruct sensitive customer data from a publicly accessible customer churn prediction model deployed by a consumer banking institution.  The attacker uses a model inversion attack to infer protected attributes like income and credit score, violating customer privacy.
initial_goal: Infer customer demographics (age, income, credit score) from a deployed customer churn prediction model.
enterprise_context: Investment/Consumer Banking: A large bank has deployed a publicly accessible API for a customer churn prediction model to assess the effectiveness of marketing campaigns. The model accepts anonymized customer features as input, but the attacker is attempting to reverse engineer the anonymization.
